Sam_Riggs:
{{short description|American country music singer-songwriter}} {{Use mdy dates|date=January 2019}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Sam Riggs | image = SamRiggs (cropped).jpg | landscape = | alt = | caption = Riggs performing in 2014 | birth_name = | birth_date = | birth_place = [[St. Cloud, Florida]], U.S. | origin = [[Austin, Texas]], U.S. | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | occupation = Singer-songwriter | instrument = | years_active = 2007–present | label = Deep Creek Records | associated_acts = [[Ray Wylie Hubbard]] | website = {{url|https://www.samriggsmusic.com/}} }} '''Sam Riggs''' is an American [[country music]] singer-songwriter. ==Biography== Sam Riggs was born in [[St. Cloud, Florida]].{{cite news|last1=McDonnell|first1=Brandy|title=Interview and video: Texas country-rocker Sam Riggs makes an impression with "When the Lights Go Out," plays tonight at Grady's 66 Pub|url=http://newsok.com/article/3887302|accessdate=May 13, 2016|work=[[The Oklahoman]]|date=September 27, 2013}} He moved to [[Austin, Texas]] in August 2007 when he was 19 years old. He worked in [[manual labour]] but also performed his songs in local cafes and bars.{{cite web|last=Erlewine|first=Stephen Thomas|title=Sam Riggs {{!}} Biography & History|url={{AllMusic|class=artist|id=mn0003180318/biography|pure_url=yes}}|publisher=[[AllMusic]]|accessdate=May 13, 2016}} Riggs released his first [[extended play]], ''Hairpin Trigger Heart'', in 2010. He met [[Ray Wylie Hubbard]] in 2011, who taught him his [[fingerstyle guitar|fingerpicking]] style. Riggs sold all of his possessions to finance the release of his second extended play, ''Lighthouse'', released in 2012.{{cite news|last1=Martinez|first1=Federic|title=Newfound success leaves Sam Riggs "Breathless"|url=http://www.gosanangelo.com/entertainment/music/newfound-success-leaves-sam-riggs-breathless-2d795f6a-986d-2cd1-e053-0100007f78f2-371568071.html|accessdate=May 13, 2016|work=[[San Angelo Standard-Times]]|date=March 9, 2016}} Riggs' full-length debut album, ''Outrun the Sun'', was released on October 29, 2013 by Vision Entertainment.{{cite news|last1=Whitaker|first1=Sterling|title=Sam Riggs and the Night People, 'Outrun the Sun' – Exclusive Album Stream|url=http://theboot.com/sam-riggs-and-the-night-people-outrun-the-sun-stream/|accessdate=May 13, 2016|work=The Boot|date=October 23, 2013}} The album was released under the moniker Sam Riggs and the Night People.{{cite news|last1=Burchard|first1=Jeremy|title=Sam Riggs Steps Towards National Success with 'Breathless'|url=http://www.wideopencountry.com/breathless-sam-riggs-takes-big-step-towards-national-success/|accessdate=May 13, 2016|work=Wide Open Country|date=February 2, 2016}} The first two singles reached the top 10 on the Texas Music Chart.{{cite news|last1=Webb|first1=Pennylynn|title=Sam Riggs: A star on the rise|url=http://www.palestineherald.com/community/sam-riggs-a-star-on-the-rise/article_3fa0daf8-c09f-11e5-814f-9bbd65c8954e.html|accessdate=May 13, 2016|work=[[Palestine Herald-Press]]|date=January 21, 2016}} The video for the single "When the Lights Go Out" peaked at number one on [[CMT (U.S. TV channel)|CMT]]'s fan-voted Pure 12 Pack Countdown.{{cite news|last1=Clark|first1=Rob|title=Country music singer Sam Riggs excited for upcoming show at Hurricane Harry's|url=http://www.theeagle.com/news/local/country-music-singer-sam-riggs-excited-for-upcoming-show-at/article_fe0e5936-8f6f-52a5-9138-c41dd0b81f19.html|accessdate=May 13, 2016|work=[[The Bryan-College Station Eagle]]|date=January 23, 2014}} One of the album's songs, "Collide", was featured in the TV show ''[[Nashville (2012 TV series)|Nashville]]''.{{cite news|last1=Wenger Watson|first1=Julie|title=Sam Riggs: A Journey to Texas Country|url=http://nodepression.com/interview/sam-riggs-journey-texas-country|accessdate=May 13, 2016|work=[[No Depression (magazine)|No Depression]]|date=August 31, 2015}} The album sold over 10,000 copies{{cite news|last1=Horton|first1=Greg|title=Country artist Sam Riggs to play Wormy Dog|url=http://okgazette.com/2015/07/22/country-artist-sam-riggs-to-play-wormy-dog/|accessdate=May 13, 2016|work=[[Oklahoma Gazette]]|date=July 22, 2015}} and earned him Artist of the Year at the first Texas Magazine Texas Music Awards. In February 2015, Riggs released "Second Hand Smoke", the first song from his second studio album.{{cite news|last1=Rodgers|first1=D. Patrick|title=5 Minutes in Texas With Sam Riggs|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/5-minutes-in-texas-with-sam-riggs-20150220|accessdate=May 13, 2016|work=[[Rolling Stone]]|date=February 20, 2015}} The album, ''Breathless'', was released on February 19, 2016. Riggs produced the album with Eric Herbst.{{cite news|title=First Listen: New Artist Sam Riggs|url=http://www.countryweekly.com/music/first-listen-new-artist-sam-riggs|accessdate=May 13, 2016|work=[[Nash Country Weekly]]|date=February 11, 2016}} It was released on his own record label, Deep Creek Records, and funded by a [[Kickstarter]] project.{{cite news|last1=Hoover|first1=Carl|title=More than just 'Lucky': Sam Riggs returns to Waco with hit album, single|url=http://www.wacotrib.com/entertainment/accesswaco/music/more-than-just-lucky-sam-riggs-returns-to-waco-with/article_b45c4adb-b115-5114-a76a-9187f42de799.html|accessdate=May 13, 2016|work=[[Waco Tribune-Herald]]|date=March 17, 2016}} ''Breathless'' debuted at number 12 on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' Country Albums chart and number 168 on the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]], selling 3,800 copies in its first week of release.{{cite news|last1=Bjorke|first1=Matt|title=The Country Album Sales Chart: February 29, 2016|url=http://roughstock.com/news/2016/02/39856-the-country-album-sales-chart-february-29-2016|accessdate=May 13, 2016|work=Roughstock|date=February 27, 2016}} On February 1, 2019, Sam released his first single of 2019, "Obsessed" and on March 1, 2019, he released his current single, "Until My Heart Stops Beating". ==Personal life== Riggs is currently married and has a son.{{cite web|url=http://www.mysanantonio.com/entertainment/entertainment_columnists/john_goodspeed/amp/Rocking-country-singer-songwriter-Sam-Riggs-at-11949928.php|title=Rocking country singer-songwriter Sam Riggs at Floore's|date=August 22, 2017|work=My San Antonio}} ==Discography== ===Albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2" style="width:14em;"| Title ! rowspan="2" style="width:18em;"| Album details ! colspan="4"| Peak chart positions |- style="font-size:smaller;" ! width="45"| [[Top Country Albums|US Country]]
